um did a tremendous amount of research we looked at Hadoop we looked at in memory from from SAP with Hana we looked
at combinations of of different kinds of solutions and ultimately went to a Hana
architecture and um simplified the original architecture greatly and Rel so

could process anticipating that linear growth and we added more functional
value right there are certain kinds of questions that if you try to ask of data
today the computing power doesn't exist to ask it efficiently now I can ask those questions and I can get the answer

that we knew would happen but we didn't understand kind of the the the the m
magnitude of the value proposition to us was and Sven talked about this earlier in my earlier architecture you saw
ETL you don't see ETL anymore right so the data goes into Hana
and all of that NLP processing that I need to do that used to happen in stream
through the ETL process now happens in place in the database there is no read extract
transform run through the NLP and then put it back into a dimensional model the data comes into the database and is
acted upon in place by the NLP so not only do I get the Computing horsepower
of Hana I get to eliminate ETL huge huge performance gain for us
off the charts um and ultimately
increased speed of processing the data through increased speed of respon time to users took us from 26 plus servers
